nicole.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability.

christine.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability.

private_information: Preference: would rather not meet on Monday before 14:00
anna.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability and respects my preference.

terry.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability.

julie.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability.

abigail.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability.

orchestrator.goal: Orchestrate the PDDL inputs from participants to produce a combined PDDL domain and problem that schedules a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that fits everyone's availability.

public_information: We need to schedule a single 30-minute meeting on Monday during work hours 09:00-17:00
Participants are nicole christine anna terry julie abigail
Each participant has existing busy slots that must be respected
There exists at least one feasible time slot that works for all participants

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems for scheduling targeting the FastDownwards solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that are compatible with FastDownwards. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is nicole. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->nicole->private_information} This is your goal: {agents->nicole->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file for FastDownwards that encode your availability constraints and allow finding a 30-minute meeting slot. If you miss some information do not make assumptions, just encode what you know. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems for scheduling targeting the FastDownwards solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownwards. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct and merge their availability constraints into a single planning problem.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are six participant agents providing PDDL domain and problem fragments. Your goal is: {agents->orchestrator->goal} You will receive their PDDL responses: {pddl_nicole} {pddl_christine} {pddl_anna} {pddl_terry} {pddl_julie} {pddl_abigail} Integrate these PDDL responses, resolve naming ambiguities, keep actions for each agent distinct, and produce a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file for FastDownwards that schedules a 30-minute meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that respects every participant's busy slots and Anna's preference. Think step by step and provide the combined PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the combined PDDL problem between <problem></problem>.
